meanings.definition: The action or state of being squished or pressed together.
meanings.sent1: The compression of the sponge made it smaller.
meanings.sent2: I felt the compression of the crowd as they pushed closer together.
meanings.sent3: The compression of the dough made it easier to roll out.
meanings.sent4: The compression of the trash in the bin was like fitting a puzzle together.
meanings.sent5: The compression of the spring made it bounce back with force.

meanings.definition: The reduction in size of a file or data to save space.
meanings.sent1: I used compression to make the photo file smaller.
meanings.sent2: The compression of the video file allowed it to be sent quickly.
meanings.sent3: The compression of the document saved a lot of memory on my computer.
meanings.sent4: The compression of the music file was like packing a suitcase efficiently.
meanings.sent5: The compression of the data made the website load faster.

meanings.definition: The process of applying pressure to something.
meanings.sent1: The compression of the brakes stopped the car smoothly.
meanings.sent2: I could feel the compression of the massage on my sore muscles.
meanings.sent3: The compression of the hand on my shoulder was comforting.
meanings.sent4: The compression of the hug from my friend was warm and reassuring.
meanings.sent5: The compression of the bandage helped the wound heal faster.
